intro: Angelica glabra, commonly known as European angelica, is a tall biennial or perennial herb native to Europe and western Asia. It features large, compound leaves that are deeply lobed and can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, which bloom in summer. Its roots are thick, fleshy, and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Angelica glabra thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
